comments:
Did this 3 times with 0611 00:10 and once with 0611 12:38.

I use the Update Manager Product Config dialog to add a site.  
Pointing at a site where I've unzipped Eclipse Examples (and added 
a .eclipseextension file - see Bug 66758).

Tried an alt site as well.  

Dialog prompts for a restart yes/no or apply.  Hangs after yes.

Created an attachment (id=11967)
Log for hang after exention add/restart request.

What i get every time.

Still hangs on the 0611 14:55 build.. 
(course the welcome view did not open either).

Moving to UI for comments:

It looks like this is caused by some recent changes in the UI/SWT.
Essentially, the code freezes during the Workbench.restart()

I get this log (see steps to reproduce at the end):

To reproduce the problem, unzip the SDK examples to a directory, say 
d:\examples, then create a file .eclipseextension (its content can be empty) 
in d:\examples\eclipse.
Then, open Help > Software Updates > Manage Configuration and select "Add 
extension location", and pick d:\examples. When asked to restart, select "yes".

I've got this exception twice now with the official 3.0RC2 build.

Once when I tried to add an extension site and after clicking on OK for 
restart prompt, the second time after I scanned for an update to a feature, 
retrieved the updated feature, and clicked OK to restart after installing it.

Agree it is still broke for RC2 - should be fixed by next cycle (I'm 
assuming...).  

The end result after killing the process is fine; the feature is there.  

I've not yet tried saying no to the restart, and then just shutting down and 
restarting manually, but I'm also assuming this will work and is the best 
workaround for the moment.
*** Bug 66856 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 66858 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 67224 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This is a critical scenario for Update - we must be able to restart cleanly - 
increasing severity.

Created an attachment (id=12172)
Patch to Workbench

This makes sure that the menu manager isn't updated on a window that is
closing.

The fix is to avoid having the workbench update workbench windows that are in 
the process of closing (and hence can have disposed WorkbenchActionBuilders). 
 
The fix has been reviewed by Tod Creasey, and is committed to CVS.  It is 
expected to appear in I200406152000.

This is just a cosmetic change.  It keeps the variable from being overwritten.  
In a method where everything that can be marked final is marked as such, it is 
immediately apparent which pieces of data are immutable and which are mutable. 
 
It should not affect the functionality.

Hmm. Well, it's a really short method and there's no way for the variable to be
overwritten unless someone from the UI team comes along who really wants to
override it. It seems like a bad idea to have random little snippets of code
like this that are written with different coding conventions.

I don't know how to reproduce the test case given here, but I verified this bug 
with my own test case: getting the menu manager to update after the 
WorkbenchActionBuilder has been disposed.  It seems to be fixed for me.  I'd 
appreciate someone who knows how to reproduce this specific test case verifying 
this bug as well. 
 
Verified in I200406170800, GTK+ 2.4.1, KDE 3.2.2, Linux 2.6.4.

Agreed - fixed - 0617-0800 build.

What failed for me before without effort now runs to completion just fine.
(help > software updates > manage config > add extension site > yes to 
restart).

Thanks.
